title: Live Briefing: Israel expands strikes in Syria; U.S. calls for Syrian-led political transition
content: Israel conducted more than 350 airstrikes, which it described as aimed at preventing Syrian weapons from falling into the wrong hands.
summary: Israel conducted more than 350 airstrikes, which it described as aimed at preventing Syrian weapons from falling into the wrong hands.

title: South Korean prosecutors weigh arresting president for insurrection
content: Police tried to raid President Yoon Suk Yeol’s office in martial law investigation. Yoon’s former defense minister, who has been arrested, attempted suicide in detention.

title: U.S. group travels to Syria in search of missing reporter Austin Tice
content: The fall of President Bashar al-Assad has revived hopes that Austin Tice, a journalist abducted while covering Syria’s civil war, will be found alive.

title: Mazen al-Hamada, symbol of Syrian regime’s brutality, confirmed dead
content: His body was found with about 40 others wrapped in bloody sheets and dumped at a military hospital outside Damascus.
summary: His body was found with about 40 others wrapped in bloody sheets and dumped at a military hospital outside Damascus.

title: In Syria’s former ‘slaughterhouse,’ a desperate hunt for the disappeared
content: Families searching Sednaya prison feared that they would not learn the fate of their missing loved ones — and that so much of what happened there may never be known.
summary: Families searching Sednaya prison feared that they would not learn the fate of their missing loved ones — and that so much of what happened there may never be known.

title: Iran reels from ‘tectonic shift’ in Middle East amid scramble for Syria

title: Netanyahu takes the stand in his corruption trial. Here’s what to know.

title: China reveals its playbook for dealing with impending Trump trade war
